cities.name: Caracas
cities.description: Venezuela's vibrant capital city with colonial architecture, mountain views, and rich culture

challenges.caption: Visit the historic Plaza Bolivar and take a photo with the statue
Try an authentic Venezuelan arepa at a local restaurant
Find and photograph a colorful street art mural
Take the cable car up to Avila mountain and enjoy the view
Have breakfast with a traditional cachapa
Visit the historic Caracas Cathedral
Explore a local market and try fresh tropical fruit
Take a photo at the iconic Parque Central towers
Enjoy a traditional pabellón criollo meal
Ride the Caracas metro system
Share tequeños with friends at a café
Visit the Teresa Carreño Cultural Center
Take a peaceful walk through the Botanical Garden
Try the famous Venezuelan quesillo dessert
Photograph a beautiful colonial house facade
Visit the Museum of Fine Arts
Grab a fresh empanada from a street vendor
Relax by the lake at Parque del Este
Find someone playing the traditional cuatro instrument
Pay respects at the Panteón Nacional
Buy a handmade souvenir from a local artisan
Capture the Caracas skyline at night
Try the traditional chicha beverage

Play a game of dominoes with locals

Visit a traditional bakery and try pan de jamón
Explore the historic El Hatillo neighborhood
Find a public piano and play a tune
Buy fresh flowers at a local market
Complete a scavenger hunt with your group
Find a statue of Simón Bolívar outside Plaza Bolivar
Try a mandoca for breakfast
Watch a local sports game at a bar
Take a photo at an iconic metro station entrance
Find the oldest church in the city
Share a meal with someone you just met
Photograph colorful houses in a hillside barrio

cities.name: Cádiz
cities.description: Spain's oldest city, where ancient Roman ruins meet golden beaches and Andalusian charm

challenges.caption: Stroll along La Caleta Beach at sunset and feel like you're walking through a movie scene.
Climb the Torre Tavira for panoramic views and a fascinating peek through the Camera Obscura.
Get lost in Cádiz's Old Town streets and find a tiny tapas bar to grab a quick bite.
Marvel at the golden dome of Cádiz Cathedral and enjoy the breezy plaza surrounding it.
Explore the ancient Roman Theatre and imagine the performances that once filled its stands.
Admire the colorful flower stalls and lively atmosphere of Plaza de las Flores.
Step inside the Cádiz Museum to uncover Phoenician, Roman, and modern treasures.
Take a relaxed walk through Parque Genovés and admire its beautifully sculpted greenery.
Walk the entire causeway to Castillo de San Sebastián and photograph where the waves crash.
Visit the Castillo de Santa Catalina for coastal views and art exhibitions.
Dive into the Mercado Central and taste fresh seafood straight from the Atlantic.
Wander along the Paseo Marítimo and enjoy ocean breezes and cheerful local energy.
Grab a drink at Circo Duende Arte + Bar and soak in Cádiz's lively nightlife.
Join a Carnival workshop or event to feel the spirit of Spain's most iconic festival.
Take a day trip to charming nearby beaches like Playa de la Victoria.
Enjoy churros with chocolate at a traditional café for an irresistible morning treat.
Rent a bike and explore the coastline at your own pace.
Listen to live flamenco and feel the emotion of authentic Andalusian culture.
Sail or kayak around the bay for a refreshing look at the city from the water.
Visit the Oratorio de San Felipe Neri, birthplace of Spain's first constitution.
Try tortillitas de camarones, Cádiz's crispy shrimp fritters.
Walk through the narrow streets of Barrio La Viña and snap a photo of colorful facades.
Catch a local performance at the Gran Teatro Falla.
Simply sit by the sea with an ice cream and appreciate how Cádiz makes time slow down.
Find a hidden tapas bar recommended by a local
Record the sound of waves crashing at the seawall
Join a sunset yoga session on the beach
Find the oldest watchtower in the city
Try a local sherry wine at a traditional bodega
Take a group photo at all four corners of Plaza San Juan de Dios
Watch the sunset from the ancient city walls
Buy a handmade ceramic souvenir
Learn to say a phrase in Andalusian dialect from a local
Photograph the colorful fishing boats in the harbor
Try a fresh tuna tapa at the market
Find street musicians and enjoy their performance
Race your friends along the Paseo Marítimo
Find the hidden courtyard of a historic building
Sample three different tapas at three different bars
Capture the reflection of buildings in a puddle
Visit a local art gallery in the old town
Buy fresh bread from a neighborhood bakery
Find a quiet spot to read for 30 minutes
Photograph the intricate details of a church door
Complete a beach cleanup with your group
Find the monument to the 1812 Constitution
Try a local dessert you've never heard of
Join locals playing cards at a plaza café
Watch the fishing boats return at dusk
Create a group video of your favorite Cádiz moments

cities.name: Lisbon
cities.description: Lisbon is a sunlit city of hills, trams, tiled façades, and river views, where tradition and everyday life blend effortlessly.

challenges.caption: Climb the walls of Castelo de São Jorge and pick your favorite viewpoint over the red rooftops.
Ride the Elevador de Santa Justa and step onto the upper walkway to look down over Baixa.
Stand under the Rua Augusta Arch and slowly turn 360° to take in the full Praça do Comércio.
Walk around Belém Tower and frame a photo with the tower and the river in one shot.
Look up at the Jerónimos Monastery façade and find the most intricate carved detail you can spot.
Pause at the Miradouro de São Pedro de Alcântara and identify three landmarks from above.
Cross Praça do Rossio and find the wave-pattern pavement beneath your feet.
Walk along the Belém waterfront until the Monument to the Discoveries lines up with the bridge.
Stand at Miradouro da Senhora do Monte and wait until a tram rattles through the scene below.
Walk across Praça do Comércio from arch to river without stepping off the square.
Walk along Ribeira das Naus until the city noise fades into river sounds.
Climb the hill to Jardim do Torel and sit in the shade for five quiet minutes.
Stroll through Jardim da Estrela and find a bench facing the basilica.
Walk the Belém riverfront promenade until the bridge dominates your view.
Climb Lisbon’s hills until you need to stop and catch your breath, then enjoy the view.
Watch the sunset from Miradouro de Santa Catarina without checking your phone.
Walk along the Tagus river at dusk and notice how the light changes on the water.
Explore Monsanto Green Corridor and walk until the city feels far away.
Find a quiet corner in Jardim Botânico and listen to the city from behind the trees.
Follow the river path near Cais do Sodré for at least ten uninterrupted minutes.
Eat a pastel de nata while it’s still warm, standing at the counter.
Order a bifana and eat it without sitting down.
Try ginjinha and decide if you prefer it with or without the cherry.
Order grilled sardines and eat them with your hands like a local.
Split a dish at Time Out Market instead of ordering your own.
Sit at a café and drink a bica without rushing.
Order a glass of Portuguese wine and ask where it’s from.
Try a petisco you can’t pronounce and guess what’s in it.
Visit a traditional tasca and eat whatever the house recommends.
End the night with a late snack and a cold beer.
Step inside the Fado Museum and learn one detail about the music’s origins.
Walk through the National Tile Museum and find a panel that tells a story.
Explore the Jerónimos Monastery cloisters and notice the repeating patterns.
Enter Lisbon Cathedral and pause under the vaulted ceiling.
Visit the Museu do Fado neighborhood and notice how music shapes the streets.
Walk through the Carmo Convent ruins and look up at the open sky.
Step into a local church and observe the azulejo panels along the walls.
Read a short plaque or inscription and summarize it in one sentence.
Visit a cultural center and explore at least one temporary exhibit.
Stand in a historic square and imagine how it looked 200 years ago.
Walk through Bairro Alto after dark and follow the sound of music.
Have a drink at a bar where people spill into the street.
Listen to live music in a small venue and stay for at least one song.
Walk through Cais do Sodré late at night and observe the crowd.
Order a drink you wouldn’t normally choose.
Dance for at least one full song, even if you feel awkward.
Stay out past midnight and notice how the city feels different.
Walk from one bar to another without checking directions.
Go to a busy bar and try to make conversation with a local.
End the night with street food before heading home.
Ride Tram 28 for at least three stops and watch the streets pass by.
Browse Feira da Ladra and pick one object you’d actually take home.
Step into a small neighborhood grocery and notice what locals buy.
Walk a pedestrian street in Baixa without any destination in mind.
Browse a local bookshop and flip through a Portuguese book.
Ride a funicular uphill and walk back down instead.
Sit in a neighborhood café and relax for a while.
Walk through Alfama following only streets that go downhill.
Browse a small craft or design shop and find something uniquely Lisbon.
Take a ferry across the Tagus and watch Lisbon shrink behind you.

cities.name: Madrid
cities.description: Madrid blends royal landmarks, world-class art, and a buzzing food scene into a city made for wandering.

challenges.caption: El Retiro Park – Rent a rowboat to paddle around the lake.
Puerta del Sol – Touch the tail of el Oso y el Madroño for good luck.
Plaza Mayor – Eat a classic bocadillo de calamares with alioli.
Gran Vía – Spot Bumblebee from Transformers and get a photo.
El Rastro – Find a vintage item for under 5 euros (bargaining encouraged).
Royal Palace – Find the armor of King Charles V.
Malasaña – Go on a pub crawl and try every kind of beer.
Bernabéu Stadium – Find the pub inside and enjoy a drink with the view.
Plaza de España – Count how many mini fountains you can spot.
Mercado de San Miguel – Try a tapa you've never tasted before.
Templo de Debod – Enjoy one of the best sunset views in Madrid.
Almudena Cathedral – Find the tiny angel statue hidden on the rooftop.
Museo del Prado – Find Las Meninas, one of the most famous paintings.
Casa de Campo – Take the cable car for an epic view of the city.
La Latina – Get a drink at an iconic wooden barrel table.
Atocha Monument – Count the trees in the Forest of the Absent without moving.
Plaza de Colón – Enjoy a well-deserved break on a bench.
Lavapiés – Try a non-Spanish dish at the square.
Chamberí Ghost Station – Spot the original 1919 tile ads.
Faro de Moncloa – Identify three landmarks from the observation deck.
Crystal Palace – Capture your reflection in the glass.
Ponzano – Meet locals and enjoy a drink on this famous street.
Paseo la Castellana – Take a stroll on this iconic avenue.
Plaza de Olavide – Enjoy an afternoon like a real Madrileño.
Visit the Reina Sofía museum and find Guernica
Record the sounds of a busy terrace at aperitivo hour
Join a group flamenco class
Find the oldest tavern in Madrid
Try vermouth at a traditional vermutería
Take a group photo jumping at Puerta del Sol
Watch street performers at Plaza Mayor
Buy a fan at a traditional shop
Learn to say a Madrid slang word from a local
Photograph the rooftops from Círculo de Bellas Artes
Try a Madrid-style cocido at a traditional restaurant
Find buskers playing in the metro
Race your friends around the Retiro pond
Find the secret garden in the Sabatini Gardens
Sample three different tapas on a tapas tour
Capture the golden hour light on the Royal Palace
Visit a contemporary art gallery in Malasaña
Buy churros from San Ginés
Find a quiet corner in the Botanical Garden
Photograph the contrast of old and new architecture
Complete a scavenger hunt in the Prado museum
Find the kilometer zero marker at Sol
Try a local craft cocktail at a speakeasy
Join locals doing outdoor exercise at a park
Watch the sunset from the Templo de Debod steps
Create a group video recap of your Madrid adventure

cities.name: Paris
cities.description: The City of Light, where iconic landmarks, world-class art, and charming cafés create endless discovery

challenges.caption: Eiffel Tower – Walk a full circle around the base and find the plaque showing the tower's height.
Seine River – Pause on a bridge and count how many boats pass in either direction.
Louvre – After seeing the Mona Lisa, find a quieter artwork and read its description.
Tuileries Garden – Sit in a green chair and observe five different people.
Notre-Dame – Walk around and find a detail you might miss at first glance.
Île Saint-Louis – Buy ice cream and eat it while walking the island's perimeter.
Latin Quarter – Find a bookstore and pick a book you'd buy if you lived in Paris.
Panthéon – Read about one person buried there whom you didn't know.
Luxembourg Gardens – Watch the toy sailboats until one reaches the edge.
Montmartre – Take a slower route uphill and notice how the streets change.
Sacré-Cœur – Pick one area you want to explore later from the viewpoint.
Place du Tertre – Watch an artist complete one detail of their work.
Paris Métro – Study the station signage and listen for different languages.
Champs-Élysées – Walk one block focusing only on architecture, not shops.
Arc de Triomphe – Look up at the carved names from beneath the arch.
Musée d'Orsay – Choose one artwork and trace where your eye moves.
Saint-Germain – Sit at a café and write down one observation about Paris life.
Le Marais – Enter a courtyard and notice how the atmosphere changes.
Place des Vosges – Walk all four sides and notice how arcades frame the space.
Centre Pompidou – Follow the escalator path visually from bottom to top.
Canal Saint-Martin – Watch the lock process and notice the water level change.
Crêpe Stop in Montparnasse – Order a galette and a sweet crêpe.
Bouillon Chartier – Order a traditional French dish and observe local diners.
Evening Seine Walk – Watch the entire Eiffel Tower sparkle sequence.
Find the hidden vineyard in Montmartre
Record the sound of accordion music near the Seine
Join a group picnic in the Luxembourg Gardens
Find the oldest café in Paris
Try a macaron from a famous patisserie
Take a group photo at the Trocadéro with Eiffel Tower behind
Watch buskers perform at a metro station
Buy a vintage book at a bouquiniste stall
Learn to say merci in three different ways from locals
Photograph the reflection of a bridge in the Seine
Try a fresh baguette from a boulangerie
Find the love wall in Montmartre
Race your friends up the Montmartre steps
Find a hidden passage and explore it
Sample cheese at a fromagerie
Capture the golden light on Haussmann buildings
Visit a small gallery in the Marais
Buy flowers at a local market
Find a quiet bench in a hidden square
Photograph the colorful doors of Paris apartments
Complete a group sketching session at the Louvre
Find the zero kilometer marker at Notre-Dame
Try a cocktail at a rooftop bar with city views
Join locals playing pétanque in a park
Watch the sunset from Pont des Arts
Create a group video of your favorite Paris moments

cities.name: Miami
cities.description: Miami blends tropical beaches, bold art, and nonstop energy into a city that lives outdoors.

challenges.caption: South Beach – Snap a picture with the iconic pastel Art Deco buildings.
Little Havana – Order a Cuban coffee and enjoy it standing like the locals.
Wynwood Walls – Find the most colorful mural and take a photo in front.
Miami Seaquarium – Watch a dolphin show and count the dolphins.
Vizcaya Museum – Explore the gardens and photograph the bay views.
Lincoln Road – Window-shop and grab an ice cream.
Biscayne Bay – Watch the sunset from a waterfront spot.
Art Deco Historic District – Find three different building styles.
Try a Cuban sandwich at a local spot.
Rent a bike and ride along the beach.
Key Biscayne – Visit the lighthouse and take a photo.
Design District – Spot an interesting piece of public art.
Coconut Grove – Explore the marina area.
Try a fresh tropical juice from a street vendor.
Watch a beach volleyball game.
Find a rooftop bar with ocean views.
Everglades – Take an airboat ride.
Record the sounds of a Latin music performance.
Join a beach yoga session.
Find the Versace mansion and take a photo.
Try key lime pie at a local restaurant.
Take a group photo on the beach at sunset.
Watch the lifeguard stands change colors at dusk.
Buy a souvenir from a local boutique.
Learn a salsa move from a local.
Photograph the palm trees against the sunset.
Try a mojito at an outdoor bar.
Find the oldest building in South Beach.
Race your friends in paddleboarding.
Find a hidden speakeasy bar.
Sample three different Cuban dishes.
Capture the neon lights of Ocean Drive at night.
Visit a contemporary art museum.
Buy fresh fruit at a farmers market.
Find a quiet spot in a botanical garden.
Photograph the colorful lifeguard huts.
Complete a beach scavenger hunt with your group.
Find the mile marker 0 sign.
Try a local craft cocktail.
Join locals playing dominoes in Little Havana.
Watch the cruise ships leave the port.
Find street art in the Wynwood neighborhood.
Record the sounds of the ocean at sunrise.
Buy a handmade item from a local artist.
Have brunch at a famous Miami spot.
Find the historic Freedom Tower.
Take a sunset cruise around the bay.
Dance to live music at a nightclub.
Watch the sunrise from the beach.
Create a group video of your Miami highlights.

cities.name: Nice
cities.description: The sparkling jewel of the French Riviera, where Belle Époque glamour meets Mediterranean soul.

challenges.caption: Climb the steps to Colline du Château for a panoramic photo of the Baie des Anges.
Walk the entire length of the Promenade des Anglais from Vieux Nice to the airport.
Pose for a photo in front of the ornate façade of the Cathédrale Saint-Nicolas de Nice.
Stand at the center of Place Masséna and count the seven 'Conversation à Nice' statues.
Marvel at the pink dome of Le Negresco hotel from the pebble beach at sunset.
Find the #ILoveNice sign at Quai Rauba Capeu for the city's most famous selfie.
Wander through the red-ochre buildings of Place Garibaldi to admire the trompe-l'œil art.
Admire the intricate clock tower of the Tour de l'Horloge in the heart of the Old Town.
Gaze up at the Monument aux Morts carved directly into the cliffside of Castle Hill.
Observe the midday cannon fire (Lou Canoun de Miejour) from the Cours Saleya.
Take a refreshing dip in the turquoise waters at Castel Plage.
Stroll through the misting fountains of the Promenade du Paillon (Coulée Verte).
Hike the Sentier du Littoral coastal path from Nice toward Villefranche-sur-Mer.
Picnic under the ancient olive trees in the Jardins du Monastère de Cimiez.
Find the hidden waterfall (Cascade de la Chute) at the top of Castle Hill.
Explore the exotic plant species at the Phoenix Parc Floral de Nice.
Watch the yachts come and go from the rocky outcrop at Pointe des Sans-Culottes.
Relax on one of the iconic blue chairs (Chaises Bleues) facing the Mediterranean.
Climb up to Mt. Boron for a view of the lighthouse and the Cap Ferrat peninsula.
Walk through the Jardin Albert 1er to see the Arc de Venet sculpture.
Eat a slice of piping hot Socca from a paper cone at Chez Pipo.
Order a classic Pan Bagnat sandwich from a street kiosk in Vieux Nice.
Sip a glass of chilled Rosé de Provence at a seaside bar on the Promenade.
Sample artisanal lavender and violet flower ice cream at Fenocchio in Place Rossetti.
Share a plate of Pissaladière (onion tart) at the Cours Saleya market stalls.
Book a table for a Niçoise dinner featuring stuffed vegetables (Petits Farcis).
Taste local Bellet wine at a boutique cellar in the city center.
Try the 'Trou Niçois'—a shot of marc de Provence—after a heavy meal.
Buy a bag of candied fruits from the historic Maison Auer chocolate shop.
Enjoy a café au lait while people-watching at the historic Café de Turin.
Explore the vibrant colors of the Henri Matisse collection at Musée Matisse in Cimiez.
Walk through the Roman ruins and the archaeological crypt beneath Place Garibaldi.
See the biblical message paintings at the Marc Chagall National Museum.
Visit the Opéra de Nice to admire its lavish 19th-century interior.
Discover modern masterpieces at the MAMAC (Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art).
Enter the Cathédrale Sainte-Réparate to see its stunning Baroque altar.
Examine the Palais Lascaris' collection of ancient musical instruments.
Attend a classical concert at the Cathédrale Sainte-Réparate or a local church.
Tour the Masséna Museum to learn about the history of the Riviera's Golden Age.
Explore the prehistoric exhibits at the Musée de Terra Amata.
Dance to live jazz at the famous Shapko Bar in the Old Town.
Experience a high-energy DJ set at High Club on the Promenade des Anglais.
Grab a craft beer and play pub games at Ma Nolan's Irish Pub.
Enjoy a cocktail with a view at the rooftop bar of the Hôtel Le Méridien.
Join the late-night crowd for a drink at Wayne’s Bar and dance on the tables.
Find a hidden speakeasy-style bar in the streets of the Petit Marais Niçois.
Watch the sunset with a drink at Le Plongeoir, perched on a rock over the sea.
Listen to local musicians busking in the evening at Place du Palais de Justice.
Bar-hop through the Rue de la Préfecture for a taste of Nice's local party scene.
Buy a bouquet of fresh peonies or mimosa at the Cours Saleya Flower Market.
Ride the Ligne 1 Tram from end to end to see the city's open-air art installations.
Hunt for vintage treasures at the Monday Antiques Market in the Old Town.
Watch a game of Pétanque at the courts in the Place du Monastère de Cimiez.
Visit Alziari to buy a bottle of world-famous Niçoise olive oil.
Board the 'Train des Pignes' for a scenic rail journey into the Provençal Alps.
Browse the independent bookshops in the winding alleys of Vieux Nice.
Rent a 'Vélo Bleu' and cycle along the dedicated bike path to the Port.
Explore the 'Marché de la Libération' for authentic local produce away from tourists.
Take the ferry to Saint-Tropez or Cannes for a day trip from the Port of Nice.

cities.name: Mexico City
cities.description: A high-altitude metropolis where ancient Aztec ruins, colonial grandeur, and cutting-edge modernism collide in a vibrant explosion of flavor and culture.

challenges.caption: Stand at the center of the Zócalo to hear the giant Mexican flag snap in the wind.
Climb the Angel of Independence steps for a panoramic view of Paseo de la Reforma.
Walk the mirrored floors of the Soumaya Museum to photograph its hexagonal steel facade.
Marvel at the Tiffany glass curtain during a performance at the Palacio de Bellas Artes.
Peer into the excavated Aztec Templo Mayor from the surrounding elevated walkways.
Admire the intricate tilework on the exterior of the Casa de los Azulejos.
Watch the sunset from the observation deck of the Torre Latinoamericana.
Explore the modernist 'Satellite Towers' (Torres de Satélite) designed by Luis Barragán.
Photograph the geometric Monumento a la Revolución from the center of Plaza de la República.
Wander through the massive stone pillars of the National Museum of Anthropology's courtyard.
Navigate the ancient canals of Xochimilco on a brightly colored trajineras boat.
Hike the trails of Bosque de Chapultepec to reach the hilltop castle views.
Walk among the volcanic rocks and native plants in the Espacio Escultórico at UNAM.
Cycle down the car-free Paseo de la Reforma during the Sunday Muévete en Bici event.
Search for the rare axolotl in the conservation centers of the Xochimilco wetlands.
Stroll through the lush ferns and orchids of the Audiorama hidden in Chapultepec.
Jog the shaded paths of Parque México in the heart of Condesa.
Take a deep breath in the Viveros de Coyoacán, the city's massive tree nursery and park.
Explore the desert flora in the botanical garden of the UNAM campus.
Escape to the pine forests and colonial convent ruins of Desierto de los Leones.
Eat 'tacos al pastor' sliced fresh from the trompo at a late-night street stand.
Sip artisanal mezcal guided by a sommelier in a dimly lit Roma Norte bar.
Try a flight of traditional pulque at a historic pulquería in the city center.
Order a morning 'guajolota' (tamal torta) from a neighborhood street vendor.
Dine on contemporary Mexican cuisine in a restored mansion in Polanco.
Dip fresh churros into thick hot chocolate at the legendary El Moro.
Taste pre-Hispanic delicacies like escamoles or chicatanas at a traditional market.
Grab a coffee and a concha at one of the trendy bakeries in Juárez.
Sample seafood 'tostadas' at a bustling stall inside Mercado de Coyoacán.
Share a bottle of Mexican wine from Valle de Guadalupe at a rooftop bar.
Admire the surreal blue walls and personal artifacts at Frida Kahlo’s Casa Azul.
Watch a high-flying Lucha Libre match at the historic Arena México.
Study Diego Rivera’s massive murals depicting Mexican history at the National Palace.
Browse the towering bookshelves of the futuristic Biblioteca Vasconcelos.
Walk through the colonial-era courtyards of the Colegio de San Ildefonso.
Visit the Shrine of the Virgin of Guadalupe during a local pilgrimage day.
View the massive collection of pre-Columbian art at the Anahuacalli Museum.
Attend a classical guitar or folk concert at the Centro Cultural de España.

Marvel at Leonora Carrington’s Cocodrilo on Paseo de la Reforma, a monumental bronze sculpture that reimagines a crocodile as a whimsical, mythic vessel ferrying a crew of smaller reptiles through the heart of the city.
Tour the minimalist studio and home of architect Luis Barragán.
Dance to live salsa and mambo at the legendary Salon Los Angeles.
Bar-hop through the neon-lit streets of the Zona Rosa.
Listen to the competing Mariachi bands at Plaza Garibaldi at midnight.
Catch an underground electronic DJ set in a hidden Juárez basement club.
Sip cocktails on a rooftop overlooking the illuminated Metropolitan Cathedral.
Find a speakeasy hidden behind a vintage telephone booth or taco stand.
Watch an indie film at the sleek Cineteca Nacional and stay for late-night drinks.
Follow the crowds to a 'Sonidero' street dance party in a local barrio.
Enjoy a jazz session at a cozy, velvet-lined club in Roma Norte.
Experience the high-energy dance floor of a multi-story nightclub in Polanco.
Ride the Cablebús over the colorful hillside neighborhoods of Iztapalapa.
Hunt for vintage treasures and antiques at the Sunday La Lagunilla flea market.
Buy hand-painted alebrijes directly from artisans at the Mercado de Ciudadela.
Browse the independent bookshops and vinyl stores of Colonia Roma.
Take the Metro during off-peak hours to see the 'Science Tunnel' at La Raza station.
Watch the Organilleros (organ grinders) perform in their traditional uniforms.
Shop for modern Mexican design at a concept store in a Juárez mansion.
Explore the Mercado de San Juan to see exotic ingredients and gourmet imports.
Walk the 'Calle de la Amargura' in San Ángel to reach the Saturday Bazaar.
Join a local 'callejoneada' (walking musical tour) through the streets of Coyoacán.

cities.name: Rome
cities.description: Rome is a sprawling museum of ancient ruins, baroque fountains, cobblestone alleys, and the unmistakable aroma of fresh pasta.

challenges.caption: Climb the steps of Altare della Patria and look out over the ruins of the Roman Forum.
Find the Aventine Keyhole and peek through to see St. Peter's Dome perfectly framed.
Walk across the bridge to Castel Sant'Angelo and count the angel statues lining the path.
Stand in the center of the Colosseum and imagine the roar of the ancient crowds.
Walk the ancient stones of the Foro Romano and find the site of the Temple of Saturn.
Hike up Palatine Hill and find the best view of the Circus Maximus below.
Enter the Pantheon and look directly up through the Oculus at the Roman sky.
Stand in Piazza del Campidoglio and admire the geometric pattern designed by Michelangelo.
Visit Piazza Navona and find your favorite detail on the Fountain of the Four Rivers.
Watch the sunset from the top of the Spanish Steps before the city lights take over.
Stand in the center of St. Peter's Square and try to align the columns of the colonnade.
Toss a coin over your shoulder into the Trevi Fountain to ensure your return to Rome.
Climb Gianicolo Hill for a panoramic view of the Roman skyline at dusk.
Walk across Ponte Garibaldi and watch the Tiber river flow beneath you.
Head to Bonci for a slice of Rome’s most famous pizza al taglio.
Wander through Campo de' Fiori and sample local cheeses or balsamic at the market stalls.
Grab a cup of gelato and find a nearby fountain to sit by while you enjoy it.
Order a plate of Paccheri Cacio e Pepe and enjoy the perfect Roman simplicity.
Break open a hot Supplì and see if you can make the 'telephone' string of cheese.
Visit a traditional osteria in Testaccio and try a dish recommended by the server.
Step into Santa Maria in Trastevere and look up at the stunning golden mosaics.
Walk the length of the Pantheon's portico and feel the scale of the ancient columns.
Walk into St. Peter's Basilica and stand beneath the massive dome.
Navigate the chaos of Piazza Venezia and watch the 'urban ballet' of Roman traffic.
Get lost in the narrow, ivy-covered side streets of Trastevere.
Stroll down Via del Corso and window shop alongside the locals.

cities.name: Test City
cities.description: A test city with sample challenges for development

challenges.caption: Visit landmark 1
